metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3116 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
The Heimdal Software Kerberos 5 implementation is vulnerable to a nullpointer dereferance. An attacker with network access to an application thatdepends on the vulnerable code path can cause the application to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3116` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

heimdal-clients - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
heimdal-kcm - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
heimdal-kdc - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
heimdal-multidev - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
heimdal-servers - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libasn1-8-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libgssapi3-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libhcrypto4-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libhdb9-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libheimbase1-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libheimntlm0-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libhx509-5-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libkadm5clnt7-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libkadm5srv8-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libkafs0-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libkdc2-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libkrb5-26-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libotp0-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libroken18-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libsl0-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
libwind0-heimdal - 7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: heimdal package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7.7.0+dfsg-1ubuntu1.1').
